3.t: Would that you knew (in detail) what the Inevitable is!

4.t: The people of Thamud and Ad denied the Day of Judgment.

5.t: The Thamuds were destroyed by a violent blast of sound.

6.t: The Ads were destroyed by a swift, destructive gale

7.t: which continued to strike them for seven and eight days so that eventually you could see the people lying dead like the hollow trunks of uprooted palm-trees.
7.tr: Sakkhara-haa 'alaihim sab'a la-yaalinw Wa-samaaniyata ayyaamin husooman fataral qawma feehaa sar'aa ka-annahum a'jaazu nakhlin khaawiyah

8.t: Can you see any of their survivors?

9.t: The Pharaoh, those who lived before him and the people of the Subverted Cities all persisted in doing evil.
9.tr: Wa-jaaa'a Firawnu Wa-man qablahoo wal-mu'tafikaatu bil-khaati'ah

10.t: They disobeyed the Messenger of their Lord and He seized them with torment which increased with time.
10.tr: Fa'asaw Rasoola Rabbihim fa-akhazahum akhzatar raabiyah

11.t: When the flood rose high and covered the whole land, We carried you in the Ark.
11.tr: Innaa lammaa taghal maaa'u hamalnaakum fil jaariyah

12.t: as a lesson for you, but only attentive ears will retain it.
12.tr: Li-naj'alahaa lakum tazki-ratanw-wa ta'iyahaa uzununw waa'iyah

13.t: With the first blast of sound from the trumpet,
13.tr: Fa-izaa nufikha fis soori nafkhatunw waahidah

14.t: the earth and mountains will be raised up high and crushed all together.
14.tr: Wa-humilatil ardu wal-jibaalu fadukkataa dakkatanw waahidah

15.t: On that day, the inevitable event will take place

16.t: and the heavens will be rent asunder,

17.t: and will turn frail, losing all force. The angels will be around the heavens and on that day eight of them will carry the Throne of your Lord above all the creatures.
17.tr: Wal-malaku 'alaaa arjaaa'ihaa; Wa-yahmilu 'Arsha Rabbika fawqahum yawma'izin samaaniyah

18.t: On that day all your secrets will be exposed.
18.tr: Yawma'izin tu'radoona laa takhfaa min-kum khaafiyah

19.t: Those who will receive the books of the records of their deeds in their right hands will say, "Come and read my record.
19.tr: Fa-ammaa man ootiya kitaabahoo biyameenihee fa-yaqoolu haaa'umuq ra'oo kitaabiyah

20.t: I was sure that the record of my deeds would be shown to me".

21.t: They will have a pleasant life

24.t: Such people will be told, "Eat and drink with pleasure as the reward for what you did in the past".
24.tr: Kuloo washraboo haneee'am bimaaa aslaftum fil ayyaamil khaliyah

25.t: However, those who will receive the books of the records of their deeds in their left hands will say, "We wish that this record had never been given to us
25.tr: Wa-ammaa man ootiya kitaabahoo bishimaalihee fa-yaqoolu yaalaitanee lam oota kitaaabiyah

26.t: and that we would never knew what our records contained.

27.t: Would that death had taken us away for good.

28.t: Our wealth is of no benefit to us

29.t: and our belief has destroyed us".

30.t: The angels will be told, "Seize and chain them,

31.t: then throw them into hell to be heated up therein.

32.t: Fasten a chain to them - seventy cubits long -
32.tr: Summa fee silsilatin zar'uhaa sab'oona ziraa'an faslukooh

33.t: they did not believe in the great God,

34.t: nor were they concerned with feeding the destitute.

35.t: On this day, they will have no friends

38.t: I do not need to swear by what you see

39.t: and what you do not see

40.t: because the Quran is certainly the word of a reverent messenger.

41.t: It is not the word of a poet but only a few of you have faith,
41.tr: Wa-maa huwa biqawli shaa'ir; qaleelan maa tu'minoon

42.t: nor is it the work of a soothsayer but only a few of you take heed.
42.tr: Wa-laa biqawli kaahin; qaleelan maa tazakkaroon

43.t: It is a revelation from the Lord of the Universe.

44.t: Had Muhammad invented some words against Us,.

45.t: We would have caught hold of him by his right hand

47.t: None of you would be able to prevent Us from doing this to him.

48.t: The Quran is certainly a reminder for the pious ones.

49.t: We certainly know that some of you have rejected it

50.t: and (on the Day of Judgment) this will be a great source of regret for the unbelievers.

51.t: This is the Truth beyond any doubt.

52.t: (Muhammad), glorify the name of your Lord, the Great One.
